name: Tonkatsu
instructions: Season pork chops with pepper and salt. Dredge the meat into the flour, shake excess flour and then dip it into the beaten egg, shake excess.
Dredge in panko, then cover the meat evenly with panko breadcrumbs by patting with your hands to make the meat is throughly covered.
Working in batches, deep fry the cutlet, until golden on the bottom for about 3 minutes. Flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes.
In a medium bowl stir ketchup, Worcestershire, soy and oyster sauce.
Serve sauce and pork chops with shredded cabbage.

name: Tomato And Cheese Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients together. Season with salt, and olive oil, and toss. Serve.

name: Turkey Wraps
instructions: Mix together the cream cheese and Dijon mustard until smooth.
Spread each tortilla with about 2 tablespoons of the cream cheese mixture, spreading to within 1/4 inch of the edge of the tortillas.
Arrange about 1/4 cup of shredded lettuce on each tortilla, and press the lettuce down into the cream cheese mixture.
Place 2 turkey slices per tortilla over the lettuce, and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of shredded Swiss cheese.
Top each tortilla evenly with tomato, avocado slices, and crumbled bacon
Roll each tortilla up tightly, and cut in half across the middle with a slightly diagonal cut.

name: Tomato Risotto With Burrata
instructions: Heat the onion with the olive oil and butter until the onion is translucent and soft, 5 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to toast until it makes a squeaking sound, 5 minutes.
Add 1/3 cup stock and stir until it evaporates. Add the tomatoes, salt, and another 1/3 cup stock.
When all the broth is absorbed, add remainingr. Keep enough liquid in the pan and stir continuously so that the rice does not stick.
Remove the rice from the heat. Serve topped with burrata cheese and serve.

name: Tuna Tostadas
instructions: Mix tuna, mayonnaise, and salsa together in a bowl. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a frying pan.
Add tortillas in batches and fry until golden and slightly crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.
Spread tuna mixture over tortillas evenly. Top with tomato, spinach, and onions.
Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese and top with avocado slices.

name: Tuna Egg Sandwich
ingredientLines: 2 hard boiled eggs, peeled and sliced
instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together the tuna, eggs, corn and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Place half of the mixture onto 1 slice of bread and the other half on another slice of bread. Top with remaining slices of bread. Serve.

name: Vegan Cabbage Soup
instructions: Combine cabbage, vegetable broth, yeast, diced tomatoes, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, and sage in a multi-functional pressure cooker.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 25 minutes. Unlock and remove lid.

name: Tuna Pickle Boats
instructions: Mix tuna, nutritional yeast, carrot, celery, yogurt, red onion, and mayonnaise together in a bowl.
Spread into the pickle halves.

name: Tomato-Shrimp Pasta
ingredientLines: ¼ sweet onion, cut into wedges
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
½ lb cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In the container of a food processor, combine the garlic, onion and oregano. Pulse until finely chopped.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion mixture and cook for 2 minutes. Mix in the tomatoes, basil, salt and pepper.
Simmer for about 5 minutes while the pasta is cooking, stirring occasionally. Just before the pasta is done, stir in the shrimp. Cook until heated through.
Toss with pasta in a large serving bowl, and mix in mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

name: Turkey Fajitas
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb skinless, boneless turkey breast, sliced
instructions: Mix chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder together in a small bowl.
Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over the turkey breast. Sprinkle seasoning mixture over the meat. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Toss to coat and set aside.
Place bell peppers and onion into a bowl and cover with remaining oil. Toss to coat.
Preheat an air fryer to 375°F according to manufacturer's instructions.
Cook the bell peppers and onion in the preheated air fryer for 8 minutes. Shake and cook another 5 minutes.
Open the basket, shake, and place turkey strips in one single layer on top of the vegetables. Close the basket and cook, 7 to 8 minutes.
Open, shake the basket to distribute mixture, and continue to cook until turkey strips are a bit crispy, about 5 minutes more.
Remove the basket and place the fajitas in a bowl or on a platter. Squeeze juice of remaining lime over.

name: Tuscan Ribollita
instructions: In a large pot over medium heat, saute garlic, onion, carrot, and celery on olive oil for 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and their juices, along with the beans, broth, and rosemary. Simmer, covered, for 30 minuntes.
Add the kale and cook for 5 minutes more, then serve, garnished with some slices of red onion.

name: Vegan 'Meat' Sauce On Polenta
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray. Add onions, cook and stir until golden, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add soy crumbles and mushroom,; cook until browned and softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato sauce, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Reduce heat to low, cook until sauce is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Oil a skillet. Cook polenta over medium heat until golden, aaccording to the intrcutions on the packaging. Serve and top woth sauce.

name: Vegan Asparagus-Mushroom Pasta
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain, reserve 1 cup of the pasta water and set aside.
Heat oil in a large covered skillet over medium heat. Add the asparagus and cook for a minute or two. Add ¼ cup water and quickly cover.
Allow the asparagus to steam for 2 minutes. Uncover and add the mushrooms. Add a splash of water if it seems dry and cover. Cook for about 2 minutes.
Uncover, add the garlic, and cook for a minute or two. Add the vegetables to the pasta and combine well. Keep warm on the lowest heat setting.
Put pasta water into a small saucepan. Place it over medium high heat and add the bouillion, basil and nutritional yeast.
As it comes to a boil, whisk together the milk and arrowroot in a small bowl and add it to the saucepan. Cook, stirring, until it boils and thickens slightly.
Pour it over the pasta and vegetables, and stir to coat. Serve immediately.

name: Tofu Scramble
instructions: Add all of the spice mix ingredients into a bowl and stir to combine.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add the olive oil.
When hot, add the mushrooms, pepper, onion, and garlic and saute for about 10 minutes until everything just starts to brown.
Add the eggs and tofu blocks and break it apart with your spoon until you get a nice scramble texture with lots of chunks.
Stir in the spice mix. Heat through for another 5 minutes until hot, garnish with shallots and serve.

name: Tomato Pasta With Beef
instructions: Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add beef, onion, garlic, oregano and salt and cook 10 minutes until beef is browned.
Add tomatoes and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add pasta and simmer on medium heat about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pasta is tender.
Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in blue cheese, parsley and serve.

name: Vegan Blueberry Basil Smoothie
instructions: Combine blueberries, water, basil, lime juice, and protein powder in a blender, blend until smooth.

name: Turkey Pesto Meatballs
instructions: Cook pasta in a pot of water for 10 to 12 minutes or by the instructions on the packaging.
Preheat the oven to 375°F. Grease a large baking pan with cooking spray.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add spinach; mix until fully cooked, 3 to 5 minutes.
In the meantime, combine turkey, pesto, egg whites, oatmeal, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper in a large mixing bowl.
Add onion-spinach mixture and mix well. Shape mixture into balls using an ice cream scoop. Place in the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, 30 to 35 minutes.

name: Tomato And Cucumber Salad
instructions: Toss cucumbers, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, garlic, parsley, and mint together in a bowl.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the salad and toss to coat; season with salt and pepper.

name: Tumeric-Mango Smoothie
instructions: Combine bananas, mango, protein powder, cashew butter, and turmeric powder in a blender, add water. Blend mixture until smooth.

name: Vegan Alfredo Pasta
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package instructions.
Heat the oil, add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Transfer the garlic into the blender, add cream cheese, yeast, lemon juice, nutmeg, water, salt and blend.
When the pasta is ready, drain it and return it to the pot over low heat.
Stir in the sauce and heat the pasta until well coated and warmed through. Serve immediately.

name: Turkey Zoodles
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add turkey breast, green pepper, garlic, Italian seasoning, ground black pepper, salt, and red pepper flakes,
Cook and stir until turkey is lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes.
Stir marinara sauce and baby spinach into the turkey mixture, cook and stir until marinara sauce is warm through, about 3 minutes.
Stir zucchini noodles into the sauce with tongs; cook and stir until the zucchini is slightly tender, 2 to 3 minutes.
Serve and top with grated Parmesan.

name: Tofu Lasagna
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Bring a water to a boil and prepare lasagna noodled according to package directions. Drain carefully and set aside on a towel.
Place the tofu, soymilk, garlic powder, lemon juice, basil, and salt in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
Cover the bottom of a baking pan with a thin layer of tomato sauce, then a layer of noodles.
Follow that with a layer of half the tofu and half the spinach. Continue, using half the remaining tomato sauce and noodles and the rest.
End with the remaining noodles covered by the remaining tomato sauce. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Vegan Cashew Alfredo
instructions: Cook the pasta in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Soak cashews in 1 1/2 cups water until softened in a bowl, at least 20 minutes.
Drain water, add almond milk. Blend mixture in an electric blender or food processor until smooth, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
Add water until sauce is slightly thinner than you want it for the final product, as it thickens when heated.
Add garlic, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, blend until smooth.
Pour mixture into a saucepan. Heat on medium-low heat, stirring occasionally until heated through and desired thickness is achieved, about 5 minutes.
You can add additional water or almond milk if sauce becomes too thick.

name: Turkey Kabobs
instructions: Mix olive oil, garlic, and mustard and toss turkey in this sauce.
On wooden skewers thread turkey and bell pepper. Place in a pan and ccok for 10 minutes on each side.

name: Vegan Bean Stew
instructions: Heat some oil and saute onion for 2 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 30 seconds.
Add celery, carrots, and saute for 2 minutes. Add tomato paste, salt and black pepper. Deglaze with red wine and boil.
Add vegetable broth, chopped tomatoes and bring to a boil. Cover with a lid and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add beans and simmer for another 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

name: Tuscan Tuna And White Bean Salad
ingredientLines: 10 oz cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large bowl combine the arugula, white beans, tuna,  and red onion.
Drizzle with the olive oil and the juice from the lemon. Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Vegan Coconut Tofu Curry
instructions: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
Bring water to a boil. Add sweet potatoes, cover, and steam until cooked through but slightly firm, 10 to 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a wok or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add tofu and saute until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Add sweet potatoes followed by nutritional yeast, curry powder, cumin, cinnamon, and salt.
Add basil. Pour in coconut milk, slowly, while stirring. Reduce heat and let simmer until thickened, about 20 minutes. Serve with cilantro.

name: Vegan Creamy Oatmeal
instructions: Combine almond milk, oats, banana, hemp seeds, chia seeds, ground flax seeds, pear cinnamon, sea salt, and vanilla extract in a pot, mix until well combined with a wooden spoon.
Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, 20 to 30 minutes.

name: Vegan Corn Chowder
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add celery and garlic; saute until slightly softened, about 4 minutes.
Add water and bouillon cubes; stir until bouillon dissolves. Add soy milk, nutritional yeast, potatoes, and onion. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add all corn, parsley, paprika, and pepper. Simmer until potatoes are soft and flavors have blended, 30 to 40 minutes more.

name: Vegan Chili
instructions: Combine diced tomatoes, water, kidney beans, red beans, onion, tomato paste, mushrooms, yellow bell pepper, orange bell pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, and salt in a large saucepan over high heat.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until all vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes. Ganrish with parsley.

name: Vegan Coconut Rice Pudding
instructions: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes.
Combine cooked rice, protein powder, cashew milk, coconut milk, coconut flakes, maple syrup, chia seeds, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a bowl, mix well.
Serve topped with blueberries and raspberries

name: Vegan Coconut Curry
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add tofu and fry on all sides until golden, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat.
While tofu is frying, heat remaining oil in a separate pan over medium heat.
Saute onion and red bell pepper until soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir in curry paste and nutritional yeast. Pour in coconut milk and vegetable broth, bring to a boil.
Add potatoes, reduce heat, and simmer, covering the pot loosely, until potatoes are halfway cooked, about 10 minutes.
Stir in beans and continue to simmer until potatoes are almost soft, about 5 minutes more.
Stir in tofu and heat through, about 5 minutes. Serve in individual bowls. Garnish with parsley.

name: Vegan Chunky Chili
instructions: Drain and rinse kidney beans, white beans and lentils.
Combine in a large pot and cover with water, boil over medium-high to high heat for 1 hour, or until tender.
Meanwhile, in a large saucepan over high heat, combine tomatoes and water, bring to a boil. Cook on high for 5 minutes.
Stir the tomatoes into the beans and add corn, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, green beans, celery, onions and tofu.
Season with salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder and chili powder to taste. Cook for 1 hour.

name: Tomato Beef Gnocchi
instructions: Brown the ground beef and onion in a skillet over medium-high heat for 10 minutes.
Stir in the garlic and Italian seasoning. Add the tomato sauce, chicken broth, cream, and gnocchi to the pan, and give it a good stir.
Once the sauce starts to bubble again, cover the pan and reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 5 minutes.
Uncover the pan, stir it, and let it cook for another few minutes, or until the gnocchi has cooked through and is nice and soft and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese and salt and pepper as needed. Serve immediately.

name: Vegan Butternut Squash Soup
instructions: Combine butternut squash, vegetable broth, potatoes, onion, carrots, and garlic in a 5-quart pot.
Cover and cook over medium-high heat until the diced squash is easily pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes. Remove from heat.
Use an immersion blender to blend soup thoroughly in the pot. Add coconut milk.
Heat over medium-high heat until warmed through, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.

name: Tilapia With Veggies
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Heat olive oil medium heat in a small pan. Add garlic and saute on low for about 1 minute.
Remove from heat and add lemon juice, bell peppers, and salt.
Arrange fish and veggies in a single layer on a sheet pan. Season fish with some paprika. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden.

name: Vegan Artichoke Potato Gratin
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Heat oil in a large skillet. Add the onions and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until onions are softened.
Add the artichoke hearts and the thyme and continue to cook another 5 minutes. Check seasoning and turn off heat.
Place the cashews in the blender with garlic powder, salt and ground black pepper to taste and 1 cup water. Blend until smooth.
To assemble the gratin, layer half the potatoes in the bottom of a baking dish. Spoon the artichoke mixture on top. Cover with the remaining potatoes.
Pour the cashew mixture over the gratin evenly. Press down on the potatoes with a spatula.
Cover the baking dish tightly foil. Place in the oven and bake 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Serve immediately.

name: Tuna Bean Pasta
instructions: Drizzle the olive oil into a pan on a medium heat. Add the parsley stalks along with the chilli flakes. Give it a good stir and add the garlic and leek.
Pour the cannellini beans including the bean water into the pan and mix.
In a separate saucepan, cook the pasta. Add about a cup of the pasta water to the bean-leek mix to thicken up the sauce.
Break the tuna into chunks and add to the sauce with the chopped parsley leaves and lemon juice. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Add cooked pasta and serve.

name: Vegan Chickpea Pasta
instructions: Warm olive oil in large, heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Add carrots, celery, and onion and cook, about 10 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Add broth, herbes de Provence, bay leaves, and black pepper to the pot with the vegetables and bring to a boil.
Add tomato sauce and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
While broth simmers, bring a pot of well-salted water to a boil and cook pasta until tender but still firm to the bite, about 7 minutes.
Drain and toss pasta with a small amount of oil to prevent sticking.
Remove soup from heat and stir in chickpeas, parsley, and lemon juice.
Combine pasta witn sauce and ladle into bowls.

name: Vegan Chive Cream Cheese
instructions: Soak cashews in a bowl of water, 8 hours to overnight.
Drain cashews and discard water. Place cashews, nutritional yeast, and salt in the bowl of a food processor.
Blend until smooth and creamy, 10 to 15 minutes. Add yogurt, mix until well combined. Stir in chopped chives. Serve on top of sourdough bread.

name: Vegan Breaded Tofu
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Coat the inside of baking dish with olive oil.
Stir mayonnaise and water together in a bowl. Place bread crumbs and nutirional yeast in a separate bowl.
Dip tofu slices in the mayonnaise mixture, press tofu into the bread crumbs until fully coated.
Place coated tofu in the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until tofu is fully cooked and breading is browned, about 30 minutes.

name: Vegan Chickpea Meatloaf
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a loaf pan with oil.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet over medium heat, stir in onion. Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add carrots, celery, and garlic, cook and stir until tender, about 4 minutes.
Combine the remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, onion mixture, chickpeas, bread crumbs, almond milk, half tomato sauce, flaxseed meal, soy sauce, salt, pepper, and sage in the bowl of a food processor.
Pulse until just combined, do not over-blend. Work in batches if needed. Press mixture into the prepared loaf pan. Brush top with remaining tomato sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 45 minutes.

name: Tofu Kale Stir Fry
instructions: Whisk coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, sriracha sauce, and ground chile powder in a bowl until a smooth sauce forms.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add Kale and saute for 1 to 2 minutes.
Add tofu, saute until lightly browned, about 4 minutes per side. Add garlic and ginger, cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour sauce into the skillet, stir to coat tofu and kale. Cook until flavors combine, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Vegan Coffee Cake Carrot Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Spray a 12-cup muffin tin with oil, or line it with cupcake liners.
Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, walnuts and salt and whisk well together.
In a larger bowl, place all remaining ingredients and use a whisk to beat the mixture for 2 minutes or until well-integrated.
Add half the flour mixture, mix well, using a rubber spatula to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl, and then add the remaining half. Mix well.
Using an ice cream scoop or a tablespoon, divide the batter equally into the cups. Bake in the preheated oven 25 minutes.
Let the muffins cool in the tin on a rack for five minutes, then unmold them and let them continue cooling on the rack.

name: Tuscan Panzanella Salad
instructions: In a large bowl combine red cherry tomatoes, onion, cucumber, ciabatta bread and basil leaves.
Make dressing with black pepper, olive oil, white wine vinegar and salt, mix until combined.
Add the dressing to the salad and toss gentnly.

name: Tso'S Shrimp And Broccoli
ingredientLines: ½ lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a skillet over medium-low heat, combine garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, tomato paste, and mustard. Bring to a boil and turn off heat.
Steam broccoli until tender in a large pot fitted with a rack. Meanwhile, in a medium mixing bowl, season shrimp with salt and pepper, dredge in arrowroot.
Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat with oil and cook shrimp until golden and cooked through.
Spoon sauce over shrimp and stir-fry until slightly caramelized. Serve on top of steamed broccoli.

name: Vegan Crispy Baked Zucchini
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Coat 2 baking sheets lightly with olive oil.
Mix flour, yeast, cornmeal, Italian seasoning, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder together in a bowl.
Lightly spray both sides of zucchini rounds with cooking spray. Dredge rounds in flour mixture, slightly pressing it into the zucchini.
Arrange coated rounds in a single layer on the prepared baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until browned on the bottom, 5 to 10 minutes. Flip and bake until browned on the second side, 5 to 10 minutes more.

name: Vegan Biryani
instructions: Combine tomatoes, onions, garlic, dried peppers, ginger, and salt together in a food processor. Grind to a fine paste and transfer to a bowl.
Place rice in a bowl with water to cover. Soak for 15 minutes. Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan and add drained rice and 1 pinch of salt.
Cook until rice is starting to soften but still firm to the bite, about 10 minutes.
Drain and transfer to a bowl. Mix in cilantro, nutritional yeast and salt to taste.
Bring 1 cup water and 1 pinch salt to a boil in a saucepan. Add potatoes and green beans.
Cook until vegetables are just starting to become tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon mixed masala paste and fry for 1 minute. Add partially cooked vegetables and 1 pinch of salt, stir gently.
Add cumin, coriander, and 1/2 teaspoon of the masala paste. Mix well and add a splash of water.
Cook for 5 minutes. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender, about 3 minutes more.
Spread partially cooked rice evenly and loosely over the vegetables in the pan, leaving small gaps for steam to escape.
Cover and cook until rice is tender, about 10 minutes.

name: Vegan Dilly Ranch
instructions: Combine cashew milk, cashews, lemon juice, chia seeds, onion powder, salt, and granulated garlic in a blender.
Blend on high speed until smooth. Add dried onion, dill, and parsley; pulse a few times more. Serve with celery and carrots.

name: Vegan Banana Oatmeal
instructions: Pour cashew milk into a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add oats and reduce heat to a simmer.
Stir in cocoa powder, salt, and cinnamon until well combined. Add protein powder and stir once more.
Cook until oatmeal has desired consistency, 1 to 2 minutes more. Pour oatmeal into a bowl and top with banana.
